Pancakes

CLASSIC WHEY PROTEIN PANCAKES

A timeless recipe for fluffy, high-protein pancakes made with whey protein, perfect for a post-workout breakfast or a healthy start to your day.

25g
Protein
180
Calories
15m
Total Time
4
Yield
Recipe Ingredients Instructions Troubleshooting Substitutions Nutrition Panel
DOWNLOAD PDF PACK
Free Resource

GET THE PRINTABLE PACK

Includes shopping list (grams), freezer guide, and the substitution matrix PDF.

DOWNLOAD PDF PACK

INGREDIENTS

  • 30g vanilla whey protein powder
  • 30g oat flour
  • 1 large egg
  • 120ml unsweetened almond milk
  • 1 tsp baking powder
  • 1/2 tsp cinnamon
  • 1 tsp vanilla extract

STEP-BY-STEP INSTRUCTIONS

1

Mix Dry Ingredients

In a medium bowl, whisk together the whey protein powder, oat flour, baking powder, and cinnamon.

2

Mix Wet Ingredients

In a separate small bowl, whisk the egg, almond milk, and vanilla extract.

3

Combine Wet and Dry

Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Do not overmix.

4

Cook Pancakes

Heat a lightly oiled griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.

5

Flip and Serve

Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Serve immediately with your favorite toppings.

TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE

Pancake is too dry

Try reducing baking time by 2-3 minutes, or add an extra tablespoon of Greek yogurt to the batter.

Not rising properly

Check that your baking powder is fresh (less than 6 months old). Also avoid overmixing the batter.

Gummy texture in center

This usually means under-baking. Use a toothpick to test - it should come out with just a few moist crumbs.

Too dense

Make sure you're measuring protein powder correctly. Too much protein powder can make baked goods dense.

SUBSTITUTION MATRIX

OriginalSwap WithMacro Impact
Whey ProteinCasein or Pea Protein+10% Liquid Required
Greek YogurtCottage Cheese (Blended)Higher Protein + Sodium
Oat FlourGluten-Free 1-to-1 BlendNeutral
Liquid Egg Whites2 Whole Eggs+10g Fat / +90 Cal
USDA Verified

PRO TIPS

üí°

Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 5 days.

üí°

For best results, use a kitchen scale to measure ingredients in grams.

üí°

Let cool completely before storing to prevent sogginess.
